'''MBAR''' is a [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] basically meaning "settle, establish", but took on considerable semantic development.<ref name=fate>{{NM|P2xi}}</ref>

In origin, MBAR had the meaning of taking up a firm position in a way that seemed suitable and resolving matters that were in confusion or doubt had arisen; basically to make a decision. It was especially applied to the concept of choosing a region for physical occupation by a family or people and ordering it as "home"; it further developed to include the erection of permanent buildings and dwellings.<ref name=dwell>{{NM|P3vi}}</ref>

[[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] notes that English "'[s]ettle' is in fact, in its various branches of meaning, a very close rendering of the sense of base √MBAR".<ref name=pe17>{{PE|17}}</ref>{{rp|163-4}}

MBAR eventually further evolved into concepts of the world as a whole ([[Quenya|Q]]. [[Ambar]] / [[Sindarin|S]]. [[Amar]]) and fate (Q. [[umbar]] / S. [[amarth]]).

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the root MBARA, from which was derived [[Qenya]] ''mar'' ("dwelling of men, -land, the Earth").<ref>{{PE|12}}</ref> In the [[The Etymologies|''Etymologies'']] appear the root MBAR- signifying "dwell, inhabit" (emended from "dwell, build, inhabit").<ref name=LR>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 372</ref><ref>{{VT|45a}}, p. 33</ref>
